title: Ticket #1643: Review new code paths for TRANSFERRING_OUTPUT
description:
Look at the bits of code that care about the JobStatus (searching for RUNNING and STAGING_OUT is a good way). Currently the STAGING_OUT code path should match the RUNNING code path. Verify that this is actually what we want, change it in places where we should.

This is per the work on #1641 and should be done on that branch, V7_5-stageout_status-branch at the moment, but #1641 is canonical.

Quick and dirty list to start from

/src/condor_gridmanager/condorjob.cpp

  • OKAY: 1309: if ( new_remote_state == RUNNING || new_remote_state == STAGING_OUT ) {
    • This is the remote state for a Condor-C job. From the local side, what does it mean if the remote side is STAGING_OUT. Probably that it's still "RUNNING" locally (meaning "the remote side is busy getting stuff done"). That way we preserve STAGING_OUT to actually mean "pulling results back to the the original submit machine.")

/src/condor_gridmanager/gridftpmanager.cpp

  • OKAY 907: case STAGING_OUT:
    • This code manages the FTP server for GT4 jobs. It really only cares that the job is "active" ("CONDITION_ACTIVE") which it is in this case.

/src/classad_analysis/analysis.cpp

  • OKAY 111: case STAGING_OUT:
    • This code only cares if a job is matched or not.

/src/condor_c++_util/user_error_policy.cpp

  • 247: case STAGING_OUT:

/src/condor_c++_util/history_utils.h

  • 231: case STAGING_OUT:

  • 2682: if( jobState == RUNNING || jobState == STAGING_OUT ) {
  • 3268: if( status != RUNNING && status != STAGING_OUT ) {

The name of the new job status has been changed from STAGING_OUT to TRANSFERRING_OUTPUT.
